byline.contributor: Matt Apuzzo and Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting.

abstract: Both the Central Intelligence Agency and Federal Bureau of Intelligence are reorganizing in ways intended to boost status of analysts; shift, brought about by evolving threat of cyberattacks and other issues, presents thorny job of meshing worlds of streetwise agent and the brainy analyst.
lead_paragraph: As the C.I.A. and the F.B.I. confront an evolving terrorist threat, cyberattacks and other challenges, both are reorganizing to empower intelligence analysts.

headline.main: C.I.A. Officers and F.B.I. Agents, Meet Your New Partner: The Analyst
headline.print_headline: Agents Enjoy Status, but Intelligence Analysts Gain Attention

snippet: As the C.I.A. and the F.B.I. confront an evolving terrorist threat, cyberattacks and other challenges, both are reorganizing to empower intelligence analysts.

keywords.value: National Commission on Terrorist Attacks upon the United States
keywords.name: organizations
